Chapter 2 Data sources 2.1 NYPD Hate Crimes Source: https://data.cityofnewyork.us/Public-Safety/NYPD-Hate-Crimes/bqiq-cu78 ## # A tibble: 6 x 15 ## `Full Complaint ID` `Complaint Year Number` `Month Number` `Record Create Dat~ ## <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <chr> ## 1 201904600132799 2019 2 02/08/2019 ## 2 201904800157499 2019 3 03/09/2019 ## 3 201904800154599 2019 3 03/08/2019 ## 4 201904800159299 2019 3 03/10/2019 ## 5 201904200333499 2019 5 05/11/2019 ## 6 201904200333499 2019 5 05/11/2019 ## # ... with 11 more variables: Complaint Precinct Code <dbl>, ## # Patrol Borough Name <chr>, County <chr>, ## # Law Code Category Description <chr>, Offense Description <chr>, ## # PD Code Description <chr>, Bias Motive Description <chr>, ## # Offense Category <chr>, Other Motive Description <chr>, Arrest Date <chr>, ## # Arrest Id <chr> 2.2 NYC Shooting Data 2.2.1 About Dataset 2.2.1.1 NYPD Shooting Incident Data (Year To Date) Source: https://data.cityofnewyork.us/Public-Safety/NYPD-Shooting-Incident-Data-Year-To-Date-/5ucz-vwe8 ## # A tibble: 6 x 19 ## INCIDENT_KEY OCCUR_DATE OCCUR_TIME BORO PRECINCT JURISDICTION_CODE ## <dbl> <chr> <time> <chr> <dbl> <dbl> ## 1 221467363 12/07/2020 05:50 BRONX 40 0 ## 2 213923358 06/06/2020 21:00 BRONX 47 0 ## 3 217218947 08/30/2020 01:39 BROOKLYN 73 0 ## 4 216209200 08/05/2020 20:01 QUEENS 104 0 ## 5 221795938 12/13/2020 16:00 BROOKLYN 75 0 ## 6 214607781 06/25/2020 19:58 MANHATTAN 30 0 ## # ... with 13 more variables: LOCATION_DESC <chr>, ## # STATISTICAL_MURDER_FLAG <lgl>, PERP_AGE_GROUP <chr>, PERP_SEX <chr>, ## # PERP_RACE <chr>, VIC_AGE_GROUP <chr>, VIC_SEX <chr>, VIC_RACE <chr>, ## # X_COORD_CD <dbl>, Y_COORD_CD <dbl>, Latitude <dbl>, Longitude <dbl>, ## # New Georeferenced Column <chr> This is a breakdown of every shooting incident that occurred in NYC during the current calendar year. (2020) This data is manually extracted every quarter and reviewed by the Office of Management Analysis and Planning before being posted on the NYPD website. Each record represents a shooting incident in NYC and includes information about the event, the location and time of occurrence. In addition, information related to suspect and victim demographics is also included. For example, has information about the sex, Age, Race of the victim. 2.2.1.2 NYPD Shooting Incident Historic Data Source: https://data.cityofnewyork.us/Public-Safety/NYPD-Shooting-Incident-Data-Historic-/833y-fsy8 ## # A tibble: 6 x 19 ## INCIDENT_KEY OCCUR_DATE OCCUR_TIME BORO PRECINCT JURISDICTION_CODE ## <dbl> <chr> <time> <chr> <dbl> <dbl> ## 1 201575314 08/23/2019 22:10 QUEENS 103 0 ## 2 205748546 11/27/2019 15:54 BRONX 40 0 ## 3 193118596 02/02/2019 19:40 MANHATTAN 23 0 ## 4 204192600 10/24/2019 00:52 STATEN ISLAND 121 0 ## 5 201483468 08/22/2019 18:03 BRONX 46 0 ## 6 198255460 06/07/2019 17:50 BROOKLYN 73 0 ## # ... with 13 more variables: LOCATION_DESC <chr>, ## # STATISTICAL_MURDER_FLAG <lgl>, PERP_AGE_GROUP <chr>, PERP_SEX <chr>, ## # PERP_RACE <chr>, VIC_AGE_GROUP <chr>, VIC_SEX <chr>, VIC_RACE <chr>, ## # X_COORD_CD <dbl>, Y_COORD_CD <dbl>, Latitude <dbl>, Longitude <dbl>, ## # Lon_Lat <chr> This is a breakdown of every shooting incident that occurred in NYC going back to 2006 through the end of the previous calendar year.(2019) This data is manually extracted every quarter and reviewed by the Office of Management Analysis and Planning before being posted on the NYPD website. Each record represents a shooting incident in NYC and includes information about the event, the location and time of occurrence. In addition, information related to suspect and victim demographics is also included. 2.2.2 Initial Questions The information about the shootings in across locations and multiple demographics can help identify groups more susceptible. Further, Historical data of the shootings can help identify dangerous neighborhoods for different groups. Possible hot-spots to avoid. Also, might help analyze the overall trend in shooting across NYC over the years/months/day-of-week/time-of-day. 2.3 NYPD Arrest Data (Year to Date) Source: https://data.cityofnewyork.us/Public-Safety/NYPD-Arrest-Data-Year-to-Date-/uip8-fykc ## # A tibble: 6 x 19 ## ARREST_KEY ARREST_DATE PD_CD PD_DESC KY_CD OFNS_DESC LAW_CODE LAW_CAT_CD ## <dbl> <chr> <dbl> <chr> <dbl> <chr> <chr> <chr> ## 1 222243929 12/25/2020 105 STRANGULATI~ 106 FELONY AS~ PL 1211~ F ## 2 222115778 12/22/2020 397 ROBBERY,OPE~ 105 ROBBERY PL 1601~ F ## 3 222090516 12/21/2020 105 STRANGULATI~ 106 FELONY AS~ PL 1211~ F ## 4 221653577 12/10/2020 105 STRANGULATI~ 106 FELONY AS~ PL 1211~ F ## 5 221599602 12/09/2020 729 FORGERY,ETC~ 113 FORGERY PL 1702~ F ## 6 221442095 12/06/2020 153 RAPE 3 104 RAPE PL 1302~ F ## # ... with 11 more variables: ARREST_BORO <chr>, ARREST_PRECINCT <dbl>, ## # JURISDICTION_CODE <dbl>, AGE_GROUP <chr>, PERP_SEX <chr>, PERP_RACE <chr>, ## # X_COORD_CD <dbl>, Y_COORD_CD <dbl>, Latitude <dbl>, Longitude <dbl>, ## # New Georeferenced Column <chr> 2.4 FBI Human Trafficking Data Source: https://crime-data-explorer.fr.cloud.gov/downloads-and-docs ## # A tibble: 6 x 19 ## DATA_YEAR ORI PUB_AGENCY_NAME PUB_AGENCY_UNIT AGENCY_TYPE_NAME STATE_ABBR ## <dbl> <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr> ## 1 2014 TNMPD00~ Memphis <NA> City TN ## 2 2014 TN00703~ Caryville <NA> City TN ## 3 2014 TXDPD00~ Dallas <NA> City TX ## 4 2014 TXDPD00~ Dallas <NA> City TX ## 5 2014 TXHPD00~ Houston <NA> City TX ## 6 2014 TXSPD00~ San Antonio <NA> City TX ## # ... with 13 more variables: STATE_NAME <chr>, DIVISION_NAME <chr>, ## # COUNTY_NAME <chr>, REGION_NAME <chr>, POPULATION_GROUP_CODE <chr>, ## # POPULATION_GROUP_DESC <chr>, OFFENSE_SUBCAT_ID <dbl>, OFFENSE_NAME <chr>, ## # OFFENSE_SUBCAT_NAME <chr>, ACTUAL_COUNT <dbl>, UNFOUNDED_COUNT <dbl>, ## # CLEARED_COUNT <dbl>, JUVENILE_CLEARED_COUNT <dbl> Many other important datasets can be found on this website. 2.5 FBI Arrest Data - Reported Number of Drug Arrests Source: https://crime-data-explorer.fr.cloud.gov/downloads-and-docs df_fbi_drug_arrests <- readr::read_csv(datasets/arrests_national_drug.csv) 2.6 NYC citizen CENSUS DATA *Source: https://datausa.io/profile/geo/new-york-ny#economy df_nyc_earnings<- readr::read_csv(https://datausa.io/api/data?measure=Household%20Income%20by%20Race,Household%20Income%20by%20Race%20Moe&Geography=16000US3651000:parents,16000US3651000,16000US3651000:similar)
Chapter 3 Data transformation 3.1 Shootings in NYC

Chapter 3 Data transformation 3.1 Shootings in NYC 3.1.1 Pre-processing Data colnames(df_shooting_old)<- toupper(colnames(df_shooting_old)) colnames(df_shooting_ytd)<- toupper(colnames(df_shooting_ytd)) Column names in the old and new data have different case, converting to a common format for merging the 2 later. Converting the date columns in both to date class using format and then merging the 2 datasets in one. 3.1.2 Feature Engineering creating more features from the existing features to help # extract year and month from date - #TODO: hour and dayofweek df_shooting_total<-df_shooting_total %>% mutate(year = year(OCCUR_DATE), month = lubridate::month(OCCUR_DATE,label = TRUE), day = lubridate::wday(OCCUR_DATE,label = TRUE)) Extracted year, month, day of the week and hour of shooting #TODO!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Calculated Percentage change in number of shootings every month.

Chapter 4 Missing values 4.1 Human Trafficking For Human Trafficking data, we analyze missing values as following: Alternatively, we can also view missing data as we can see below: ## DATA_YEAR ORI PUB_AGENCY_NAME ## 0 0 0 ## PUB_AGENCY_UNIT AGENCY_TYPE_NAME STATE_ABBR ## 3191 0 0 ## STATE_NAME DIVISION_NAME COUNTY_NAME ## 0 0 81 ## REGION_NAME POPULATION_GROUP_CODE POPULATION_GROUP_DESC ## 0 0 0 ## OFFENSE_SUBCAT_ID OFFENSE_NAME OFFENSE_SUBCAT_NAME ## 0 0 0 ## ACTUAL_COUNT UNFOUNDED_COUNT CLEARED_COUNT ## 0 0 0 ## JUVENILE_CLEARED_COUNT ## 0 4.2 Shootings in NYC dropping the missing columns, as they cannot be imputed in anyway. We intend to focus on the victim trend in this analysis. Hence, it is fine to not consider the above columns in the current analysis.

Chapter 5 Results 5.1 Shootings in NYC 5.1.1 Trend in number of shootings 5.1.1.1 yearly 5.1.1.2 monthly or yearly (DISCUSS) 5.1.1.2.1 Whole NYC ggplot(temp_df, aes(x= date)) + geom_bar(aes(y = monthly_change, fill = factor(month)), stat="identity") + geom_text(aes( label = scales::percent(monthly_change), y= monthly_change ), stat= "identity",angle = 90) + scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::percent) + ggtitle("Is it that time of the year?!", subtitle = "Percentage change in number of Shootings by month") + labs(y = "Percentage Change", x="Date", fill="Month", caption = "Source: NYC-open-Data::Shooting Incident Data") + theme(plot.title = element_text(face = "bold")) + theme(plot.subtitle = element_text(face = "bold", color = "grey35")) + theme(plot.caption = element_text(color = "grey68")) We see every year in the month of May and June the number of shootings rise. Last year, (possibly due to covid restrictions easing up) saw 92-95% increase in these months. 5.1.1.3 weekly ggplot(temp_df, aes(x= day, y = total_shots, fill = factor(day), label=sprintf("%0.2f", round(total_shots, digits = 2)))) + geom_bar(stat="identity") + geom_text( vjust=-.5) + ggtitle("Does the day of the week matter?!", subtitle = "Average number of shootings on the day of the week") + labs(y = "Average shooting count", x="Day", fill="Weekday", caption = "Source: NYC-open-Data::Shooting Incident Data") + theme(plot.title = element_text(face = "bold")) + theme(plot.subtitle = element_text(face = "bold", color = "grey35")) + theme(plot.caption = element_text(color = "grey68")) #### daily 5.1.2 Trend in number of deaths 5.1.3 Susciptible groups 5.1.4 Hot-spot neighbourhoods/AREAS (discuss!)
